docs.snippet: Billy Hunter, the executive director of the National Basketball Players Association, does not believe the problem is as rampant as it is perceived. Still, he and the player representatives for the 29 teams agree that with the N.B.A. soon to begin...
docs.lead_paragraph: Billy Hunter, the executive director of the National Basketball Players Association, does not believe the problem is as rampant as it is perceived. Still, he and the player representatives for the 29 teams agree that with the N.B.A. soon to begin testing for marijuana, it is time to educate the masses. During the union's annual meetings in the Bahamas last week, representatives were told to spread the word to their teammates about the league's new drug policy. Since marijuana can stay in a person's system for two to three months, players who use it in July run a risk of being caught in October.
docs.abstract: Basketball Notebook article focuses on National Basketball Players Association plan to alert players to league's new drug policy, which includes testing for marijuana; photo (M)

headline.main: Union Alerts Players to Treat the New N.B.A. Drug Policy Seriously

docs.snippet: Mark Jackson of the Indiana Pacers will join the Dominican Republic's national team in a pre-Olympic tournament in Puerto Rico this week, Dominican officials said yesterday. Jackson, 34, a point guard, has a Dominican-born mother.     Under an...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Jackson of the Indiana Pacers will join the Dominican Republic's national team in a pre-Olympic tournament in Puerto Rico this week, Dominican officials said yesterday. Jackson, 34, a point guard, has a Dominican-born mother. Under an agreement reached Friday with his agent, Jackson will begin playing only if the team makes the second round of the 10-nation America's Cup tournament, as expected.
docs.abstract: Mark Jackson of the Indiana Pacers will join Dominican Republic's national team in upcoming pre-Olympic tournament in Puerto Rico (S)

headline.main: Jackson to Play On Dominican Team

docs.snippet: The marquee player the MetroStars have been clamoring to sign to improve their performance on the field and bolster their attendance does not have tremendous marquee value after all. The MetroStars will announce today the signing of Henry Zambrano of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The marquee player the MetroStars have been clamoring to sign to improve their performance on the field and bolster their attendance does not have tremendous marquee value after all. The MetroStars will announce today the signing of Henry Zambrano of Colombia, the last foreigner owed them by Major League Soccer. Zambrano is a 26-year-old striker who was playing for Colombia in the Copa America tournament in Paraguay. Zambrano is not a well-known star, but he is a capable striker and could make a good partner for Eduardo Hurtado of Ecuador in the middle of the attack.
docs.abstract: MetroStars will sign Henry Zambrano, striker from Colombia (S)

docs.snippet: Uruguay's crop of talented youngsters earned a spot in Sunday's Copa America final last night by beating Chile, 5-3, on penalty kicks after the teams played to a 1-1 tie in Asuncion, Paraguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's crop of talented youngsters earned a spot in Sunday's Copa America final last night by beating Chile, 5-3, on penalty kicks after the teams played to a 1-1 tie in Asuncion, Paraguay.
docs.abstract: Uruguay beats Chile, 5-3, in semifinals of Copa America soccer tournament (S)

docs.snippet: With seven minutes remaining and the verdict already in, Tim Duncan made a move toward the basket in the United States national team's 97-69 exhibition victory over Canada on Sunday in Orlando, Fla. But before the world's best player could finish the...
docs.lead_paragraph: With seven minutes remaining and the verdict already in, Tim Duncan made a move toward the basket in the United States national team's 97-69 exhibition victory over Canada on Sunday in Orlando, Fla. But before the world's best player could finish the play with a short, smooth bank shot, he was leveled by the Canadian center, Todd MacCulloch, and sent to the floor, clutching his left heel. As Duncan laid on the court for several minutes, the Team USA coach, Larry Brown, imagined something horrible. ''When he went down, I was. . . .'' said Brown, never completing his sentence. ''He grabbed his heel and I thought it was the Achilles'. I thought the worst.''
docs.abstract: US will play Uruguay in first game of pre-Olympic Qualifying Tournament of Americas in San Juan, PR, on July 15; photo (M)

headline.main: Only Two Concerns for U.S.: Duncan's Ankles

docs.snippet: Brazil, the event's defending champion, coasted into Sunday's Copa America final against Uruguay by beating Mexico, 2-0, last night in a semifinal match in Ciudad del Este, Paraguay. First-half goals from Amoroso and Rivaldo proved enough for Brazil...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil, the event's defending champion, coasted into Sunday's Copa America final against Uruguay by beating Mexico, 2-0, last night in a semifinal match in Ciudad del Este, Paraguay. First-half goals from Amoroso and Rivaldo proved enough for Brazil in its quest for a sixth championship in the oldest surviving tournament in international soccer.
docs.abstract: Brazil beats Mexico, 2-0, in semifinals of Copa America soccer tournament (S)

docs.snippet: Kevin Garnett and Gary Payton scored 20 points apiece as the U.S. national team rolled to a 118-72 victory over Uruguay last night in San Juan, P.R.     It was the first game of the Olympic qualifying tournament for the Americans, who toyed with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Kevin Garnett and Gary Payton scored 20 points apiece as the U.S. national team rolled to a 118-72 victory over Uruguay last night in San Juan, P.R. It was the first game of the Olympic qualifying tournament for the Americans, who toyed with the awestuck, undersized Uruguayans from the get-go and led by as many as 52 points.
docs.abstract: US beats Uruguay, 118-72, in first game of Olympic qualifying basketball tournament for Americans (S)

headline.main: Garnett and Payton Lead U.S. to Victory

docs.snippet: From Monday through Wednesday, Tabare Vazquez fights cancer as one of Uruguay's leading oncologists. From Thursday through Saturday, he runs for President -- and along the campaign trail he wags his finger at smokers urging them to ''lay off the...
docs.lead_paragraph: From Monday through Wednesday, Tabare Vazquez fights cancer as one of Uruguay's leading oncologists. From Thursday through Saturday, he runs for President -- and along the campaign trail he wags his finger at smokers urging them to ''lay off the poison.'' For Mr. Vazquez, the 57-year-old former mayor of the capital, Montevideo, campaigning is like making a house call. As wintry winds blow off the pampas, he walks up and down streets of small towns telling people to button up or go to bed to nurse a sniffle.
docs.abstract: Tabare Vazquez, who is one of Uruguay's leading oncologists, and former mayor of capital, Montevideo, is waging busy campaign for President, leading leftist coalition of former Tupamaro guerrillas, Communists, Socialists and Trotskyites; political leaders of Uruguay's two traditional centrist parties, including Pres Julio Maria Sanguinetti, contend Vazquez is really a Marxist wolf in disguise who would destroy Uruguayan economy; polls indicate that Vazquez stands head-to-head with Jorge Batlle of center-left Colorado Party with three months remaining before first-round vote; former Pres Luis Alberto Lacalle of center-right Blanco Party is falling well behind; Vazquez photo; map (M)

headline.main: With Kinder Face, the Left Is Blossoming in Uruguay

docs.snippet: Brazil laid the ghost of last year's World Cup final humiliation by France to rest by outclassing Uruguay, 3-0, to win the Copa America yesterday in Asuncion, Paraguay.     Two first-half goals from Rivaldo and a strike after the halftime from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil laid the ghost of last year's World Cup final humiliation by France to rest by outclassing Uruguay, 3-0, to win the Copa America yesterday in Asuncion, Paraguay. Two first-half goals from Rivaldo and a strike after the halftime from Ronaldo insured the victory for the pre-tournament favorites
docs.abstract: Brazil beats Uruguay, 3-0, and wins Copa America soccer tournament in Asuncion, Paraguay (S)

headline.main: Rivaldo and Ronaldo Lead Brazil in Final

docs.snippet: Brazil briefly flirted with the impossible tonight, giving the United States its first scare of the Olympic qualifying tournament in an 90-73 victory for the Americans.    In the toughest game for an American team of National Basketball Association...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil briefly flirted with the impossible tonight, giving the United States its first scare of the Olympic qualifying tournament in an 90-73 victory for the Americans. In the toughest game for an American team of National Basketball Association professionals since the gold-medal match against Yugoslavia in the 1996 Olympics, the United States found itself leading by only 3 points early in the second half. But Steve Smith, Tim Duncan and Allan Houston broke the United States out of its lethargy, scoring all but 2 points in a 30-11 run that gave the Americans a 78-56 lead with seven minutes left.
docs.abstract: US beats Brazil, 90-73, in Olympic qualifying basketball tournament; photo (M)

headline.main: U.S. Gets Past Brazil, But It's Far From Easy
